newsitem.title: EGYPT: Holiday mood slows Cairo bourse trade, prices up.
newsitem.headline: Holiday mood slows Cairo bourse trade, prices up.

text.p: A holiday mood continued to slow trading at the Cairo stock exchange on Sunday but prices rose despite thin demand, brokers said.

The Capital Market Authority (CMA) all-share index rose 0.41 percent to 288.89. Volume was a high 92.6 million pounds, buoyed by the sale of one million shares in Amriyah Cement to big investors at prices ranging from 67.01 and 71.00 pounds.

"It was another quiet day but I think the bourse will definitely leap within the first few weeks of January when the foreign investors come back to the market," said Youssef Khalil of brokerage firm Delta/EAB.
Amriyah Cement, in which the state is planning to sell another 2.4 million shares, topped the day's turnover and shares fell 0.25 pounds to 68.00.
Medinet Nasr Housing and Development was the bourse's biggest gainer and share in the privatised firm rose 32.11 percent to 390.00 pounds.
The state sold its majority in Medinet Nasr eight months ago and shares were priced at 60 pounds each.
"Investors are clamouring for the shares after they heard that it would give a free share in addition to a cash dividend soon,"Khalil said.
Cairo stock exchange officials effectively strangled trading in favourite realty firm Heliopolis Housing and Development by freezing the share price, brokers said.
The brokers said prices of Heliopolis heavily-traded shares will remain at 430 pounds until a CMAcommittee investigates claims that the stock is overpriced.
CMAofficials were not immediately available for comment.
"The committee will meet within this week but its quite ridiculous. There are real reasons why this company rose and its not just speculation," one broker said.
The CMAindex for openly traded firms rose to 432.44 points from 431.61 on Wednesday while the index for rarely traded "closed" firms also rose to 203.72 from 202.62.
Of the 90 shares traded, losing stocks outnumbered gainers 20 to 28 while the rest ended unchanged.
